WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for reporting this! The issue has been fixed and can be tried out in the upcoming 0.9.5 release. We also have a beta available (https://typescript.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=TypeScript%200.9.5%20beta) if you'd like to try it out.
WorkItem.Description:
Steps to reproduce:
- Start a native/non-web application in VS2012 in the debugger
- Start IE, open a website which includes typescript code (source maps are correctly set up)
- Go to the debug menu, attach to process
- Choose the IE
- The debugger correctly attaches and shows .ts files which belong to the javascript files
- debugging is possible in .ts files
- Close IE, but keep the native application running
- Start a new IE instance
- Again attach to IE
Result:
- the typescript files do NOT show up in the debugger. Only debugging of javascript is possible
WorkItem.Summary: When RE-attaching to IE, typescript debugging does not work

Comments.Message: Thanks for the clear repro steps - marking active
